cc:Work.dc:title: Panda and the Flower
cc:Work.dc:description: Panda takes a walk in the forest and learns the value of patience.

text.tspan: Panda
and the
Flower

g.desc: Scene 1: Panda finds one flower in the forest.
Side shot of Panda walking in the woods

text.tspan: One warm spring day, Panda took a walk in the forest.
While she was walking, she saw a red flower.

g.desc: Panda stops and looks happy and thinks.

text.tspan: “Oh my!” she said. “That is a beautiful red flower.”
“It would look very pretty in my hair.”
She reached down to pick the flower.
Just then, the flower said, “If you wait, there will be more.”
So Panda waited.

g.desc: Scene 2: Panda returns and sees more flowers.
Side shot of Panda walking in the woods with more flowers

text.tspan: A few days later, Panda was walking in the forest again.
There were more red flowers, just like she was told.
“Oh my!” she said.
“I could have one for my hair, and I could give some to my friends.”
Again the flower said, “If you wait, there will be more.”
So Panda waited.

g.desc: Scene 3: Panda returns and sees even more flowers. She cannot carry them all. She gets an idea.

text.tspan: When Panda went for a walk a few days later,
she saw many, many flowers.
“Oh my!” she said.
“There are enough flowers for my hair, my friends and more.”
“But I can't carry them all! What should I do?”
Again the flower said, “If you wait, there will be more.”
Then Panda had an idea.

g.desc: Scene 4: Panda and her friends come back and have a picnic in the middle of the flowers.

text.tspan: A few days later, Panda went to the forest with her friends.
Flowers were blooming everywhere!
The flowers were like a red carpet on the floor of the forest.
The whole forest smelled sweet, and the sun was warm.
So Panda and her friends sat down and had a picnic.
And it was a very nice day.
The end.
